item.title: Senior Consultant/Modeler, Decision Science
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

The Decision Science team is a central hub of data science expertise within Personal and Business Banking, and is leading the way in applying the best practices in predictive science, machine learning, leveraging massive datasets and the latest in big data technology platforms to truly revolutionize personalization to drive client experience. The Senior Consultant/Modeler ensures that sound analytical methods and processes are followed and predictive models are built on sound data samples. As a Senior Consultant you will apply your knowledge and experience of data modelling to solve challenging business problems and bringing innovative solutions. This position pro-actively contributes to the portfolio management function in the area of model building, model governance and model performance monitoring and other analysis to help optimize the effectiveness and profitability of projects, marketing campaigns, pricing, contracts and other business decisions across our products. You’ll interact with groups across the organization from Products, Segments, Marketing to Channels and Risk. You will work with structured and unstructured data to produce end-to-end solutions, taking models from experiment to deployment. The position will also act as a main point of contact for communicating effectively to Product Business partners requirements, questions and concerns related to all models and related model performance.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1 day per week on-site, while other days will be remote.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Data Science Expertise: Provide advanced analytics solutions to solve business problem leveraging traditional statistical, machine learning and optimization techniques. Ability to conduct self-directed research, typically using non-traditional resources to solve business problems.

  • Modeler: Participate in model development by conducting detailed quantitative analysis work to support the model development. Support deploying statistics and machine learning models in development and production environments. Work closely with senior modelers to facilitate effective dissemination of model related documents and model governance and model performance to business partners.

  • Business Consulting: Conduct business problem assessment independently. Gather relevant information related to business processes, functions and operations to evaluate data credibility and quality. Utilize creative thinking to modify or select the most suitable procedure/approach to solve a business problem. Perform in-depth analysis for the purpose of identifying revenue generation and cost saving opportunities, developing proposals and make recommendations for model usage to the downstream partners.

  • Market Relevancy: Participate in an analytics community whose goal is to foster and share analytic approaches across the enterprise. Liaise with internal and external sources, colleagues, and others to obtain, provide, verify and discuss information and best practices. Passionate innovators, creators, collaborators, and leaders who are up for the challenge of building the bank of the future and delivering solutions that meet our clients’ changing needs

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience in working with large datasets including both structured and unstructured data and related tools (e.g., SQL, Spark). Must have experience coding in high level programming languages such as SAS, R or Python. Must have experience coding with data modelling packages in SAS EG and Enterprise Miner.

  • You’re a certified professional. You have current accreditation and good standing in Master or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Operational Research, Physics, Economics or related quantitative field.

  • You\'re digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends.

  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.

  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to bring a shared vision to life.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.

  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.

  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Expected End Date

2021-12-31

Job Location

Toronto-81 Bay, 25th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

Advanced Analytics, Big Data, Business Decisions, Communication, Data Analysis, Data Science, Predictive Analytics, Profitability

item.title: Consultant, Risk Analytics
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You\'ll Do

  • Credit Risk Analytics
  • Support the development of proposals/business cases for credit risk scorecards, system or rule changes that will enhance credit risk management performance
  • Conduct pre and post-analyses of acquisition strategy performance.  Provide objective and sound feedback on the performance of acquisition strategies.  Make specific recommendations to improve future performance
  • Quantify and grade risk-adjusted profit as well as credit risk performance
  • Actively monitor the performance of key origination strategies.  Alert senior management to any signs of potential emerging risk or performance degradation
  • Build deep subject matter knowledge of (i) TTD adjudication system rules, tables and cutoffs and (ii) acquisition campaign criteria.  Assess the merits of adjudication cutoffs and rules logic for TTD and campaign channels.  Ensure that cutoffs align with RACD’s risk appetite
  • Play a lead role in managing the TTD decision engine simulation environment
  • Ensure accuracy and integrity of data throughout the analytical process.  Play a lead role in continuously improving the breadth and quality of available data
  • Invoke champion/challenger methodologies as appropriate
  • Build and maintain sound working relationships with key business partner groups such as Product Management, Technology, etc.
  • Design and build new tracking and reporting capabilities to evaluate strategy performance

  • Reporting and Insights

​

  • The candidate would be required to have extensive knowledge of how to develop dynamic dashboards, charts and graphs that senior leadership can drill down into and use to understand trends.
  • Experience in Excel Pivot tables, calculations, graphs and charts is essential and candidate must be able to customize these as requested by team
  • Being able to develop dynamic dashboards (in Tableau/PowerBI) that can be used for different types of views into the data

  • Data Manipulation and Analytics Skills

​

  • The candidate must be comfortable with advanced SQL queries and must be able to use SQL to draw relevant data, integrate it and clean it in a data hub environment.
  • The Candidate should have an in-depth knowledge of how to work in SAS and should be comfortable understanding existing SAS code and developing their own SAS queries to pull, integrate and output data.
  • Strong experience in Python is essential and the candidate must be able to manipulate and analyze large, complex datasets in addition to being able to build their own datasets from existing data sources.
  • Knowledge of Data science and Analytics concepts is essential as candidate will be expected to support model development efforts in the Risk Modelling sphere
  • Experience with models like Decision Trees. Random Forest, XG Boost as well as associated concepts such as hyper parameter tuning, model validation and model monitoring.

  • Communicating findings
  • Must be comfortable communicating complex ideas during presentations in a simple and concise manner to facilitate understanding
  • Should be able to use data and visuals to derive narratives that explain trends and insights
  • Knowledge of Financial Risk terms
  • A strong grasp of financial terms used in Risk as well as their interpretation is strongly preferred.
  • Candidate must be able to understand and interpret complex financial data as well as spot any anomalies and inconsistencies in financial data
  • Comfortable working in Excel and Python to perform complex financial calculations that are dynamically updated with new inputs

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate atleast 2-3 years of experience in principles of credit analysis and risk management relating to retail lending portfolios, preferably in the autolending space.  Prior experience in retail credit is essential
  • You have a strong financial background and can understand financial information in the portfolio as well as spot and explain anomalies
  • Ability to interpret and analyze information to formulate solutions.  Strong problem solving skills evidenced by a proven track record
  • Experience with acquisition risk strategy development, including implementation via automated risk management systems such as Decision Manager, Capstone
  • Knowledge of advanced Excel functionality including pivot tables and charts, string manipulation, lookups, and filters.
  • Knowledge of at least one dashboarding software (Tableau, PowerBI etc.)
  • Strong experience in Python, SAS and SQL is a pre-requisite.
  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.
  • You\'re passionate about people. You find meaning in relationships, and surround yourself with a diverse network of partners. You build trust through respect and authenticity.
  • You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

Toronto-81 Bay, 29th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

item.title: Consultant, Business Analytics, Capital Markets Operations
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You\'ll be Doing

As the Consultant, Business Analytics, you will provide consulting support on the development, analysis and identification of process changes and system enhancements for CIBC\'s Capital Markets Operations unit and the Operations unit more broadly. You will proactively analyze and recommend streamlining enhancements to the existing business processes; clearly communicate the rationale and negotiate solutions which will enhance operational effectiveness and maintain CIBC\'s competitive edge. You will provide partner support with Vendor Management, including providing opinions and expertise on options and solutions for vendor change requests (Business cases, RFI, RFQ for vendors). You will ensure that all initiatives are implemented in an effective manner within area of responsibility and may lead projects related to the development and implementation of new policies, procedures and standards. You build and maintain strong partner and vendor relationships to accelerate delivery for change. You create current/future state assessments, provide thought leadership into key findings and perform change management.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Data Sciences and Technical capabilities - Advanced SQL, Power BI, Tableau, VBA/advanced Macros, Think Cell, Alteryx, ADO (Azure), MS Access Database, Python to refine data. Able to build dashboards.
  • Understanding Business Processes– Understand operational processes, ideally related to capital markets and wealth management business processes and products. Provide a continuous improvement mindset and proven record of adding value by finding efficiencies and automations in current processes and procedures, consequently enhancing the performance of operations teams by proactively participating in project activities.
  • Business Analysis and Operations Processing - Demonstrate experience with requirements gathering, designing or modifying processes, managing the change and implementation as well as working with a wide variety of business partners. Organize and lead the implementation of operational changes. Provide value through an operational processing background and have a good understanding of capital markets and wealth management business processes, products applications and systems.
  • Relationship Building/Communication - Demonstrate excellent verbal and written communication skills and excel at developing relationships with internal and external business partners. Develop and recommend client focused solutions to routine and non-routine operational problems, incident mitigation and improvements that promote more straight through processing. Welcome the opportunity to represent your area of specialization and provide input into the development and implementation of projects.

Who You Are

  • You embrace and advocate for change. You continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.
  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems and making sense of information. You communicate detailed information in a meaningful way.
  • You look beyond the moment. You know what you do will make a difference today and tomorrow. You look for new opportunities to define what\'s possible.
  • Your influence makes a difference. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by sharing your expertise.
  • You\'re digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends.
  • You act like an owner. You thrive when you\'re empowered to take initiative, go above and beyond, and deliver results.
  • You\'re fluent in self-serve technical tools such as Tableau and VBA/macro; Alteryx; advanced SQL

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.
  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.
  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

Toronto-55 Yonge Street, 5th

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

item.title: Director, Acquisition and Account Management, Unsecured Lending
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

Reporting to the Senior Director, Unsecured Lending, this position will be responsible for all Unsecured Lending acquisition and account management campaigns, including development of new channels.  You will drive the development and enhancement of pricing, risk scorecards, business optimization models, campaign execution paradigms and client franchising objectives by building and maintaining key relationships with Risk, Analytics & Decision Science, Marketing, Technology, Infrastructure & Innovation and other units.  As partners develop proposals and outputs, you will represent the business in providing feedback and refining the outcome; and, when complete, you will lead the application of these tools to the business. You will continuously strive to work with partners towards a common goal of maximizing risk adjusted profitability in all current products and channels.  In addition, you will support the business and engage with partners to create the pricing, risk and analytic foundations for entirely new product channels or constructs where required. At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Strategic Leadership - Take accountability for leading the development of an empirically driven and risk-conscious culture within Unsecured Lending, and take accountability over profit and risk outcomes. Own the outcomes of client pricing and account management strategies so as to optimize long-term risk-adjusted returns. Be an acknowledged leader within the team on awareness of industry trends and products, particularly in the area of bureau scores and bureau data, and other data sources and techniques that could be used to predict risk-adjusted profitability.
  • Drive Growth – Lead the development and deployment of all acquisition and account management campaigns in Unsecured lending.  In the short-term, ensure current state frameworks are applied as efficiently as possible.  In the long-term, aim to continuously improve and enhance campaigns by working with Analytics and Risk to optimize pricing to maximizing risk adjusted profitability.  Drive continuous loop of feedback and improvement in dialogue with partners.  Also lead the development of franchising efforts, working with other partners to optimize efforts at cross-selling to newly acquired clients. 
  • Risk Management - In partnership with Risk and others, represent the business in articulating objectives with an impact on of credit strategies and scorecards, and work collaboratively to help build tools that meet business objectives prudently.  Guide the implementation of optimal models in account repricing and line management, and ensure maximum share of wallet through account management, adjusted for Risk.  Be accountable for risk outcomes of strategies, and maintain and continuously enhance a culture of collaboration with Risk partners.
  • Data Analytics – Represent the business in translating business requirements into prioritized analytic work for Analytics & Decision Science teams and other applicable units.  Own the implementation of all analytic refinements to the business, and drive continuous improvement and feedback with analytic partners.  Guide the development of key measures and reports necessary to track and manage the effectiveness of existing models.
  • Manage Relationships – In addition to key relationships with Risk and Analytics & Decision Science, develop relationships with Marketing, Banking Center/Telephone Banking, Technology Infrastructure & Innovation, other lines of business and third parties, to ensure the effective implementation of short- and long-term business objectives.  Evaluate external vendor analytics, and consult with internal partners on validity and added benefit any project under consideration. Manage with external partners to ensure that Unsecured Lending has state-of-the-art tools and technology to meet our goals.
  • People Management/ Leadership - Create and sustain a high performing, inspired workplace which is consistent with the values of CIBC and ensure that progressive approaches are used in the management of human resources.  This includes: champion coaching model for managers; align employee reward and recognition around positive customer experience; ensuring consistent Performance Management practices throughout the business; career and succession planning; calibration sessions within team and across division; attracting & developing top talent to fill key roles in the team, in support of the evolving business.

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate 5 plus years’ experience in predictive analytics with elements of credit risk and profit optimization related to retail Unsecured Lending or related products.
  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way, and translate business requirements into detailed requirements and feedback to professional statisticians and data scientists.
  • You have a University degree.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.
  • You are a caring and accountable leader. You have experience developing and implementing strategic team goals. You have experience coaching employees and inspiring successful team performance.
  • You\'re passionate about people. You find meaning in relationships, and surround yourself with a diverse network of partners. You build trust through respect and authenticity.
  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.
  • You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to bring a shared vision to life.

What CIBC offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.
  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.

We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

Toronto-81 Bay, 24th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

item.title: Consultant, Risk Business Intelligence Office
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

As Consultant of the Risk Business Intelligence Office (RBIO) you’ll apply your Technical skillset and knowledge of Risk Management to enhance risk domain business intelligence. You’ll participate in collaborating with business owners to capture detailed requirements and aid in supporting our technical teams to deliver reporting solutions using the Business Intelligence tools available.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Business Analysis – Work with owners of the various source systems that feed into our central data warehouse. This includes attending regular meetings to discuss new initiatives and planned promotion schedules in order for us to be able to synchronize our system with such upstream changes. In addition, provide support to our BI Developers with business requirements and UAT testing.
  • Collaborate – Work with technology teams that support our systems. They depend on our expertise to provide detailed requirements to implement our initiatives. Strengthen existing mutually beneficial relationships with external teams including the technology team.
  • Project planning and execution - As part of your business intelligence and data management responsibilities, you will participate in managing and tracking various commitments to our clients, helping to ensure that critical deadlines are closely monitored and not compromised.

Who You Are

  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
  • You demonstrate experience in having a thorough understanding of and extensive experience with data warehouses, data querying tools (SQL), BI Tools (Cognos, Tableau), experience with large data models and preparing data mapping and business requirement documents
  • You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to bring a shared vision to life.
  • You have a degree in computer science or mathematical studies. Business Analyst Certification is an asset.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

item.title: Consultant, Business Systems Analysis
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You\'ll Be Doing

As a Business Systems Consultant you will be responsible for providing management reporting and business analytics to support IT Senior Management. This includes creating and delivering regular and ad hoc reports as well as conducting analysis to support business decisions and initiatives

How You\'ll Succeed

  • Data Analytics & Reporting: Gather key business metrics that will support management and risk reports on a regular basis. Perform business analysis to support business decisions and initiatives.  Provide Information Governance by maintaining a Metric Dictionary and calendar of key deliverables
  • Understanding and Documenting Requirements - Work closely with business partners to gather complex business requirements and facilitate solution design discussions to ensure you meet project needs. Build strong relationships, lead discussions, listen and ask the right questions to ensure solutions meet requirements.
  • Leading and Mentoring – Support technology project implementation as a data subject matter expert, and provide guidance to a diverse team of technology and project professionals. Maintain a collaborative work environment and support team members to resolve organizational, operational, and process problems.

Who You Are

  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it’s the right thing to do.
  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
  • You\'re driven by collective success and your influence makes an impact. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to create a shared vision. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • You have strong business acumen, including 4 to 8 years of working experience, preferably with 2 years of consulting experience. A university degree is required (Engineering, Computer Science or Business preferred) with an MBA being nice to have. A developed working knowledge of the IT industry is essential. Operations Risk experience is an asset.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Regular

37.5

Skills

item.title: Sr. Manager, AML
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

Risk Analytics and Risk Modelling is responsible for the development of analytics to measure and optimize AML and credit risk performance.  The AML Analytics team supports the development of AML risk strategy to deliver  CIBC\'s client experience, risk management, and business growth objectives. Reporting to the Director, the Senior Manager, AML Analytics is responsible for independently leading and supporting the analytical requests of the AML compliance program and is responsible for the effectiveness of all AML data quality, accuracy and analytics.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Quantitative Analytics – Lead the quantitative analytical work based on model risks, business needs and regulatory requirements while fostering a continuous improvement culture. Demonstrate considerable knowledge and analytic capabilities through the development of quantitative data analysis and data mining solutions, emphasizing the development of database driven reports and analyses. Maintain a high level of competency in statistical and analytical principles, tools and techniques. Assesses data quality and potential impacts.
  • Technical / Data Modelling Skills – Develop rules and models that continuously improve the effectiveness of the AML transaction monitoring systems and AML Sanction screening systems. Have the ability to translate business requirements to technical specifications for technology to implement, also have the ability to review and assess technology systems relative to business requirements. You have proven experience in the management of complex technology systems and testing and implementing changes to technological systems. You will also be required to support/participate in data quality efforts and the expansion of transaction monitoring coverage to new product types.
  • Communication & Collaboration  – Manage relationships with technology partners and external vendors to ensure the systems supporting the program are operating effectively and efficiently. You have the ability to coordinate efforts within compliance teams as well as across multiple business units and possess excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to interact with all levels of the organization

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate minimum 7 years’ experience in in analytics or technical fields, ideally in a financial services industry, or regulatory agency or law firm involving compliance issues. SQL programming and conducting data mining, query performance and tuning. You also have a good understanding  with statistical and computer software, or other analytical tools such as SAS, R, SQL, Python, Microsoft Word/Excel/Power Point, knowledge in UNIX or PC environment for modeling.
  • You ideally have strong knowledge of: AML regulations, OFAC laws, practices and economic sanctions, which may be enhanced via accreditation by ACAMS (Association of Certified Anti-Money Laundering Specialists), or similar certification, or become certified within first year of employment. It’s an asset if you have working knowledge of Customer Due Diligence and Transaction Monitoring modules and anti-fraud or compliance systems.
  • You have a degree/diploma in M.S. degree or above with emphasis in Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Engineering, or related quantitative fields
  • You embrace and champion change. You\'ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.
  • You look beyond the moment. You make decisions and take actions that will make a difference today and tomorrow. You proactively seek new opportunities to define what\'s possible.
  • You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability. 

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

Toronto-81 Bay, 29th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

Advanced Analytics, Predictive Analytics, Risk Analytics, Sanctions Screening, Transaction Monitoring

item.title: Sr. Retail Credit Risk Manager
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

The Optimization Model Development team is responsible for the design and development of data-driven credit risk management strategies for all stages of the retail credit life cycle. Reporting to the Director, Optimization Model Development, the Senior Manager, Optimization Modeling will be tasked with developing advanced statistical models that evaluate credit risk across a variety of retail credit portfolios including credit cards, personal loans and lines of credit, residential mortgages, small business loans, and collections. The incumbent will be able to lead the development of optimization projects from beginning to end and propose innovative solutions to technical problems. Also, the successful candidate will write technical model documentation to support the model vetting and validation process. Additionally, the Senior Manager, Optimization Modeling will need to engage with various partner units to understand business problems and to present key results to senior management. The incumbent will use statistical software such as SAS Enterprise Guide, SAS Enterprise Miner, and FICO Decision Optimizer to develop various predictive models and optimization models, conduct supplemental statistical analyses and provide statistical modeling expertise.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Technical expertise. Develop and execute statistical/machine learning models for all retail risk systems. Understand and generate critical actionable insights from data.

  • Innovation and problem solving. Develop optimal strategies to respond proactively and reactively to market situation and new business opportunities.

  • Effective communication. Engage with business partners to understand business needs and develop suitable modeling and analytics solutions. Communicate essential results, implications, and insights to senior management.

Who You Are

  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems and making sense of information, while proactively proposing innovative solutions. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way

  • You can demonstrate experience in  modeling, including at least 5 years of relevant work experience with cleaning, merging, modeling and extracting insights from the data and partnering with business subject matter experts. You can also demonstrate expertise in SAS or other advanced data modeling tools. Experience of retail credit risk is a big asset asset. Knowledge of FICO Decision Optimizer is also an asset.

  • You have a graduate degree in areas with exposure to statistical or machine learning coursework (Statistics, Math, Analytics, Economics, Engineering, Data Science).

  • You love to learn. You\'re passionate about growing your knowledge, and you know that there is no limit to what you can achieve

  • You embrace and champion change. You\'ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.

  • You engage with your heart and mind. You care about people and understand different perspectives. You listen and learn from the experiences of others.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home.

  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity.

  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training.

  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

Toronto-81 Bay, 29th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills
